JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant married O.L.F. The couple had CARDINAL son , born on DATE . In DATE , ORG left the couple 's home , taking her son with her , and since then both of them have been living with the maternal grandparents .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG granted the couple 's divorce and awarded the mother custody of the child . This judgment was upheld by a decision of ORG of DATE and by a final decision of ORG of CARDINAL DATE . A social investigation conducted in the framework of the divorce proceedings indicated that PERSON was not working and was receiving a DATE unemployment allowance of MONEY a month .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought an action for the establishment of his rights of contact with the child . ORG , by a judgment of DATE , granted the applicant visiting rights for DATE between certain TIME , DATE during DATE and DATE during DATE . Allowing the applicant 's appeal against that judgment , ORG , by a decision of DATE , extended his visiting rights as follows : DATE from TIME on DATE until TIME on DATE , during DATE , and during DATE . By a final decision of ORG of DATE , following the mother 's appeal on points of law , the applicant 's visiting rights were limited during DATE to the period from DATE and during DATE to the period from DATE and remained unchanged in respect of the DATE .

CARDINAL . Faced with his ex - wife refusal to allow him to visit the child during the prescribed periods , on DATE the applicant lodged an application with the bailiff for enforcement of the judgement of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the bailiff sent a request to ORG to issue an interlocutory order to have the said judgement declared enforceable . On DATE , the district court allowed the request .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , the bailiff initiated the enforcement actions , by issuing a first summons to O.L.F. on DATE . Official records drawn up by the bailiff during the period from DATE record attempts to enforce the contact rights defined by the judgement of DATE and modified by the final decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the mother and the child were not present at their home and the bailiff issued a new summons for DATE . On that date the mother allowed the applicant to see the child at her home and refused to let the child leave the house , declaring that an appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE was pending .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE and DATE , the mother was not at home and the grandparents refused to hand over the child , claiming that they had not received a copy of the final decision . On these occasions the bailiff issued a summons to the mother to comply with the judgment granting the applicant visiting rights .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE , the applicant lodged a new request for enforcement of the final decision of DATE . On DATE , the district court allowed the request and declared the said decision enforceable .

CARDINAL . A new summons was therefore issued on DATE , inviting PERSON to comply with the final decision granting the applicant visiting rights . On DATE , the bailiff took note that the mother initially refused to hand over the child , stating that he did not want to join his father . She was asked by the bailiff to bring the child to the gate and persuade him to join his father . The child was taken outside into the courtyard and the mother invited the applicant to enter the courtyard and take the child . The applicant requested that the child be brought to the gate , but then the child went back into the house when he heard his mother crying . Then the mother started to reproach the applicant and the bailiff for causing distress to the child .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant took the child from kindergarten to his home . O.L.F. lodged a civil action to have the child returned to her . By a decision of DATE of ORG the applicant was ordered to return the child . On DATE the same bailiff , accompanied by the mother , summoned the applicant to return the child . The applicant complied but he also requested that O.L.F. respect his right to maintain personal links with the child . On that occasion , the mother undertook to respect his visiting rights .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , the grandparents refused to hand over the child , on the first occasion because he was sick and on the second occasion because he was not at home . The father handed over clothes , toys and fruit for the child . The bailiff gave notice of the fact that a summons would be issued for DATE and he reminded the family of the obligation to allow the child to join his father during the period from DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the mother refused to hand over the child , claiming that he was sick and refusing to bring him outside to talk to his father and to receive the fruit that the applicant had brought for him .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the bailiff noted that the grandparents refused to hand over the child , as ORG was not at home and the child refused to join his father . The bailiff took note that the applicant did not insist on taking the child against his will .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the bailiff reported that the mother wanted to hand over the child but the latter refused to join his father . The child was brought to the gate , but as he was crying and refused to join his father he was taken back into the house . The applicant did not insist on forcing the child to go with him and asked the bailiff to take note of the fact that the mother had not made any effort to persuade the child to join him .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the next date for the enforcement of the visiting rights , the bailiff drew up a report which stated that the applicant did not present himself for the appointment and did not contact the bailiff beforehand , leading the latter to assume that the parties had reached an agreement . The bailiff , also taking into account the applicant 's refusal to force the child to join him against his will , decided not to pursue the enforcement further until a new enforcement request was made by the applicant .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant maintained that he had subsequently made further attempts to visit his child , but in the presence of witnesses , as the bailiff refused to accompany him any more due to the allegedly aggressive attitude of the mother and the grandparents . He also maintained that the procedure with the bailiff had become financially burdensome , especially taking into account the fact that no practical result could be achieved .

CARDINAL . The applicant further submitted that subsequently he wanted to get information about the school results of the child , but that O.L.F. prevented him from being around the child or his school teacher . He maintains that he tried to meet the child at school or at his house , he brought gifts to him on his birthday on DATE and for DATE , but he was not allowed to see the child and the presents were refused . No supporting documents were submitted to the case file in this respect .

CARDINAL Faced with the constant refusal of the mother to comply with the decisions granting him visiting rights , on DATE the applicant lodged a first criminal complaint against O.L.F. for noncompliance with measures regarding child custody and visiting rights .

CARDINAL . On DATE criminal investigations were initiated in respect of O.L.F. By a decision of DATE , ORG attached to ORG terminated the criminal proceedings and imposed on O.L.F. an administrative fine of CARDINAL NORP lei ( PERSON ) . This decision was based on the reasoning that during the investigations ORG had acknowledged that she had prevented the applicant from meeting his child , but had done so because the judgment awarding him contact rights was not final , since appeal proceedings were still ongoing . The fact that the child did not want to go with his father was also taken into consideration .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , a second criminal complaint was lodged on DATE and criminal investigations were initiated on DATE . Following the investigations , on DATE ORG attached to ORG terminated the criminal proceedings against PERSON and imposed on her an administrative fine of LAW . The prosecutor noted that PERSON admitted that the applicant could not see the child , but she submitted that this was mainly due to the child 's reluctance . Moreover , PERSON did not have a criminal record and the CARDINAL parents were in a conflict situation . All these elements led the prosecutor to consider that the attitude of PERSON did not present the danger to society that a crime would present . This decision was upheld by a resolution of the first prosecutor of DATE and by a final decision of ORG of DATE .

CARDINAL . A third criminal complaint lodged by the applicant on DATE was dismissed on DATE by a decision of the prosecutor , taking into account that the matters invoked by the applicant had already been examined during the CARDINAL previous criminal proceedings . From the information available in the case file , it does not appear that the applicant lodged a judicial complaint against the prosecutor 's decision .

CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW and of LAW are stated in the ORG 's judgement in the case PERSON v. GPE , ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE and CARDINAL , DATE ) . The role and responsibilities of the local public authorities for social assistance and child protection as well as the relevant provisions of the Law no CARDINAL/CARDINAL on child protection are described in the judgement GPE , ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
